p: The distribution of rural RWHAPs providers varied by geography ( Fig 1). Over half of states/territories had a provider that was in a rural area (n = 31/54, 57.4%). Among states with rural providers, the proportion of rural providers within the state ranged from a low of 0.8% in Florida (n = 3/361 providers) to a high of 92.0% in New Hampshire (n = 23/25 providers). Five states had more than one-quarter of their providers located in rural areas: Kentucky (33.3%) Montana (70.0%), South Dakota (75.0%), Maine (87.5%), and New Hampshire (92.0%). The number and percentage of rural providers for all states and territories are available in S1 Table.
